results.title: I'm a fool
results.creator_credit: Noel Black, Dan McCann and Perspective Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
This adaptation of Sherwood Anderson’s short story tells of a few milestones in the life of an adolescent boy who, at the turn of the century, left home and attempted to make a life of his own. Stars Ron Howard.

results.title: Almos' a man
results.creator_credit: Stan Lathan, Dan McCann and Perspective Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
Dave - a black, teenage worker - buys a used hand gun and accidentally kills a mule. Consequently, his father demeans him in front of the landowner, who demands that he work 25 months to pay for the animal. At nightfall, aimed with vague notions of manhood and independence, Dave retrieves his gun and hops aboard a passing train.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
An adaptation of John Updike’s short story written in 1964 in which a middle aged writer attempts to find some meaning for his life. Narrated by Colleen Dewhurst.

results.title: Ambrose Bierce's 'Parker Adderson: Philosopher'
results.creator_credit: Arthur Barron, Ozzie Brown and Perspective Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
Parker Adderson is a captured Yankee spy whose facile philosophy and flippant concern for life arouse a Confederate general’s instinct for sham. The harsh reality of his impending execution brings abrupt character changes in Adderson, and a vicious battle in the general’s tent ensues.

results.title: Tuesday's child
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “The American scene”
A dramatisation of the roles of a small girl, her parents and doctors in dealing with the problem of mental retardation in children and what is being done to prepare them for adult life.

results.title: Library of Congress
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of War Information
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “The American Scene”.
An account of the scope and methods of operation of the Library of Congress at Washington. Science, painting, music, literature and history are shown as some of the interests of the Institution. The library’s contents include valuable historical documents, newsreel records of outstanding events and personalities, Braille and talking books (on disc) for the blind, in addition to much material of general public interest. Includes a concert performance of music from manuscript collection and library staff in the field recording little known folk musicians.

results.title: A Better tomorrow
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of War Information
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The American Scene”.
A study of progressive education in three schools in New York, where the emphasis of teaching is placed on the fact that learning is a normal and vital part of every child’s day-to-day development; what the child is taught in school should therefore bear a discernible relation to the world around the child, and be a challlenge to their increasing skills and expanding understanding of how to manipulate the things whcih surround them.
